thread.title: 10-15 Bengals practice report: All 53 on active roster take part

title: 10-15 Bengals practice report: All 53 on active roster take part
text:
10-15 Bengals practice report: All 53 on active roster take part 
Updated: Thu, Oct 15 2015, 03:56 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- The Bengals had a rare occurrence for an NFL team this deep into the season when on Thursday all 53 players on the team's opening day roster practiced at least in some capacity. 
Defensive back Leon Hall was the only player who wasn't a full participant as he was limited due to a back injury that prevented him from practicing at all on Wednesday. 
Hall, who is used primarily in nickel coverage, left Sunday's 27-24 overtime win against the Seattle Seahawks at some point in the second half, although no official injury update on him was given during the game. He wound up playing only 13 snaps. 
Three other players who didn't participate in Wednesday's practice were full participants on Thursday: starting cornerback Adam Jones, who had a groin injury; wide receiver Brandon Tate, who was ill and offensive tackle Andrew Whitworth, who was given a veteran's day off. 
Four players who were limited participants in Wednesday's practice were full participants on Thursday: wide receiver Marvin Jones (foot); cornerback Dre Kirkpatrick (hip); offensive tackle Andre Smith (elbow) and guard Kevin Zeitler (elbow). 
Photo: Tony Tribble for Local.12 
Follow us on Twitter @Local12 and LIKE us on Facebook for updates!
